titles.title: Child Nicotine Poisoning Prevention Act of 2014
Child Nicotine Poisoning Prevention Act of 2014
A bill to require the Consumer Product Safety Commission to promulgate a rule to require child safety packaging for liquid nicotine containers, and for other purposes.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.

calendar.text: Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation. Reported by Senator Rockefeller without amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 571.

action.text: By Senator Rockefeller from Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation filed written report. Report No. 113-311.

bill.summary: 9/18/2014--Reported to Senate without amendment. Child Nicotine Poisoning Prevention Act of 2014 - Directs the Consumer Product Safety Commission (CPSC) to promulgate a rule requiring liquid nicotine containers to be designed with special packaging that is difficult for children under five years of age to open or to obtain harmful contents from.
